That's great to hear! Incorporating leg exercises into your yoga routine can help improve overall lower body strength, balance, and flexibility. Here are some effective exercises that target your glutes and calves:

**Glute Exercises:**

1. **Squats**: A classic exercise that targets the gluteus maximus, hamstrings, and quads. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, then bend knees and lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the ground.
2. **Lunges**: Works the gluteus maximus, hamstrings, and quads. Stand with feet together, take a large step forward with one foot, and lower your body until your back knee almost touches the ground. Alternate legs.
3. **Glute bridges**: Targets the gluteus maximus. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the ground, then lift your hips up towards the ceiling, squeezing your glutes at the top.
4. **Donkey kicks**: Works the gluteus maximus. Start on all fours, then lift one leg up and back, keeping your knee bent at a 90-degree angle. Alternate legs.
5. **Side lunges**: Targets the gluteus medius. Stand with feet together, take a large step to one side, and lower your body until your back knee almost touches the ground. Alternate legs.

**Calf Exercises:**

1. **Calf raises**: Targets the gastrocnemius muscle. Stand on the edge of a step or platform with heels hanging off, then raise up onto your tiptoes and lower back down.
2. **Calf raises on a leg press machine**: Works the gastrocnemius muscle. Sit on a leg press machine with your feet shoulder-width apart on the platform, then press the platform away from you, extending your legs. Lower the platform back down to the starting position.
3. **Seated calf raises**: Targets the soleus muscle. Sit on a chair or bench with your legs extended in front of you, then lift your heels as high as you can and lower them back down.

Remember to start with lighter weights and higher reps (12-15) to focus on toning and endurance. As you get stronger, you can increase the weight and lower the reps.

It's great that you've started incorporating stretching exercises into your daily routine! Focusing on your legs and hips will help improve flexibility and range of motion. Make sure to hold each stretch for 20-30 seconds and breathe deeply, feeling the stretch in your muscles.
